body_html:
I build and run the inspect_checkpoint tool. Yes, i am not using model.ckpt-0, which is the first model file, but using the intermediate file like model.ckpt-354 below.

bazel-bin/tensorflow/python/tools/inspect_checkpoint --file_name=/home/scopeserver/RaidDisk/DeepLearning/mwang/tensorflow/v1_finetune_test/model.ckpt-354

In the output tensors list from inspect_checkpoint, i can see the one in the error message, which mean the tenor is indeed in the .ckpt file:

InceptionV1/Conv2d_2c_3x3/BatchNorm/moving_variance (DT_FLOAT) [192]
InceptionV1/Logits/Conv2d_0c_1x1/biases/RMSProp_1 (DT_FLOAT) [269]
InceptionV1/Mixed_5c/Branch_1/Conv2d_0a_1x1/BatchNorm/moving_mean (DT_FLOAT) [192]

body:
I build and run the **inspect_checkpoint** tool. Yes, i am not using **model.ckpt-0**, which is the first model file, but using the intermediate file like **model.ckpt-354** below.

bazel-bin/tensorflow/python/tools/inspect_checkpoint --file_name=/home/scopeserver/RaidDisk/DeepLearning/mwang/tensorflow/v1_finetune_test/**model.ckpt-354**

In the output tensors list from **inspect_checkpoint**, i can see the one in the error message, which mean the tenor is indeed in the .ckpt file:

InceptionV1/Conv2d_2c_3x3/BatchNorm/moving_variance (DT_FLOAT) [192]
**InceptionV1/Logits/Conv2d_0c_1x1/biases/RMSProp_1** (DT_FLOAT) [269]
InceptionV1/Mixed_5c/Branch_1/Conv2d_0a_1x1/BatchNorm/moving_mean (DT_FLOAT) [192]
